Title: Aiken Teen Center
field_1: Red Shield Youth Center of Aiken Teen Center
field_23: Worship Services - Children's / Teen|Community Recreation Programs
field_24: NSC Aiken Red Shield Youth Center
AboutThisCenter: Our After - School Program is designed to make afternoons easier for families and more enriching for students. Children enjoy a healthy snack, dedicated homework time, and fun activities that support learning and social skills. We also have a literacy program to help strengthen reading confidence. Pickup from select schools is available.
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d:
Your time and talents can make a real difference in the lives of youth at our centers! Whether you’re helping with after-school programs, summer camps, family nights, or special events, volunteers are an essential part of our mission.


How to Get Involved:
Fill out the online Volunteer Interest Form
Attend a brief orientation and background check
Choose from a variety of opportunities that fit your schedule and skills


Volunteer Coordinator Contact:
Name: Kathleen Hutto 
Email: kathleen.hutto@uss.salvationarmy.org
Phone: (803)522- 2963


Once you submit your interest, Kathleen will contact you with next steps and help match you with the right opportunities at the center nearest you.


Opportunities Include:
Mentorship and tutoring programs
Summer camp counselors and activity leaders
Event support for family nights, community fairs, and alumni gatherings
Administrative and creative support


Join us in shaping the next generation of leaders, builders, and changemakers!

Title: Allegany County
FooterScriptureVerse: “Train up a child in the way he should go; and when he is old, he will not depart from it.” — Proverbs 22:6
field_1: Red Shield Youth Center of Allegany County
field_23: Worship Services - Children's / Teen|Community Recreation Programs
field_24: PMC Allegany County Red Shield Youth Center
AboutThisCenter:
Where After-School Turns Into After-Adventure!

At The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center of Allegany County, kids don’t just show up — they grow, learn, and belong. Our high-energy, high-quality after-school programs are designed for children and teens of all ages who are ready to discover their strengths and have a blast doing it!

Our caring staff and awesome volunteers jump in with one-on-one homework help, literacy support, and study skill boosters that help every student shine. Plus, with no-fee or low-cost options, families can feel confident knowing their kids are getting the very best support without the stress.

And it’s not all pencils and papers — our members get to play sports, build athletic skills, and make real friendships in a safe, positive environment where everyone belongs.

Smart minds. Strong bodies. Kind hearts.
That’s what the Red Shield is all about. Let’s grow together!
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d:
Want to Make a Difference? Join Our Red Shield Volunteer & Mentor Team!

Becoming a volunteer or mentor at The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center of Allegany County is easy — and incredibly rewarding! Whether you love helping with homework, shooting hoops, leading crafts, or simply being a positive role model, we have a place for you.

⭐ How to Sign Up

  1. Email Our Volunteer Coordinator
    Tell us a little about yourself, what you enjoy, and how you'd like to help!
    Victoria.Leasure@uss.salvationarmy.org

  2. Complete a Background Check
    Safety is our top priority. All volunteers and mentors complete a simple background check to keep our kids protected.

  3. Meet with Our Director
    Once your form is received, you’ll be invited to meet with our Youth Center Director to talk about your interests and find the perfect fit.

  4. Attend a Quick Training Session
    Learn the basics, meet our staff, and get a rundown of our programs, expectations, and best practices.

  5. Jump In and Make an Impact!
    Start helping kids succeed — academically, socially, emotionally, and spiritually. Whether you join once a week or once a month, your time truly matters.

💡 Who Can Volunteer?

  • Adults 18+

  • High school or college students looking for service hours

  • Community members who love working with kids

  • Retirees excited to share their experience

  • Anyone with a heart to help!

❤️ Why Volunteer With Us?

  • You’ll build meaningful connections

  • You’ll inspire confidence in young students

  • You’ll gain valuable experience (great for resumes!)

  • And most importantly—you’ll help kids feel seen, supported, and valued
TransportationDetails:
Transportation Information

Getting your child safely to and from The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center is one of our top priorities. We offer free, reliable transportation from select Allegany County Public Schools directly to our center each afternoon.

🚍 After-School Pick-Up

Our staff pick up registered students from the following schools:

  • South Penn Elementary
    Students are greeted by our team, checked in, and safely transported to the Youth Center.

  • Vans are ONLY used on bad weather days.

🏡 End-of-Day Dismissal

Parents and guardians may pick up their children between 5:30 PM and 6:00 PM.
For your child’s safety, photo ID is required for anyone picking up a member.

🛑 Safety First

  • All vehicles are driven by trained, certified staff members.

  • Seatbelts are required at all times.

  • Vans follow a strict roster system to ensure every child is accounted for.

  • If your child will not be riding the van, please notify us by 2:00 PM.

📞 Transportation Changes

To report an absence, change in transportation, or late pick-up, call:
301.709.3901 or send a message in the TeamReach app.

Title: Beaumont - IH-10
FooterScriptureVerse: "For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope." Jeremiah 29:11
field_1: Red Shield Youth Center of Beaumont - IH-10
field_23: Worship Services - Children's / Teen|Community Recreation Programs
field_24: TEX Beaumont Red Shield Youth Center
AboutThisCenter:
The Red Shield Youth Center of Beaumont is a safe, welcoming space where kids and teens can play, learn, and grow. Through engaging programs, mentorship, and community activities, we provide opportunities for youth to build friendships, discover new passions, and develop essential life skills.

To cultivate a thriving community where young people are empowered to reach their full potential, supported by strong families, and guided by spiritual and moral values. We envision a future where youth are inspired to lead, serve, and contribute positively to their churches, families, and communities.

With a focus on creativity, leadership, and personal growth, our center empowers young people to reach their full potential in a supportive and fun environment. Whether it’s through sports, arts, academics, or leadership programs, there’s something for everyone at the Red Shield Youth Center of Beaumont.

Title: Beckley
FooterScriptureVerse: Proverbs 3:6  In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight
field_1: Red Shield Youth Center of Beckley
field_23: Worship Services - Children's / Teen|Community Recreation Programs
field_24: PMC Red Shield Youth Center of Beckley
AboutThisCenter:
The Salvation Army’s Red Shield Youth Centers offer high-quality after-school programs for children and teens of all ages. Caring staff and volunteers provide individualized homework help, support academic growth, an​d strengthen literacy and study skills. With no-fee or low-cost options, our programs also give youth opportunities to play sports, build athletic skills, and form healthy, positive friendships in a safe and supportive environment.

The center is a 21st Century Community Learning Center for students ages 5-18 during the school year and includes an 8-week summer program in the months of July and August. Family and community nights are part of the After-School program. Music lessons and basketball programs are also offered throughout the year. Adult opportunities exist currently with open pickleball and basketball times during the week. 
Please be sure to check back often for new programming opportunities.
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d: We welcome and appreciate volunteers for our programs and events. If you are interested in volunteering, please contact either Holly.Toney@uss.SalvationArmy.org or Tracy Mason at Tracy.Mason@uss.SalvationArmy.org or stop in for an application. Volunteers who wish to serve in a capacity of more than one time in a 6-month period will need to pass a background check and be required to take Safe From Harm training.

Title: Charleston SC
field_1: Red Shield Youth Center of Charleston SC
field_23: Worship Services - Children's / Teen|Residential Camping Activities|Community Recreation Programs
field_24: NSC Charleston Red Shield Youth Center
AboutThisCenter: The Red Shield Youth Center of Charleston is a welcoming, safe, and engaging space for youth ages 6–18 to learn, grow, and thrive. Our center offers a variety of programs designed to support kids and teens year-round — including an afterschool program, summer day camp, spring break camp, and special day camps on teacher work days. We also provide youth sports training that builds teamwork, confidence, and healthy habits. At Red Shield, every young person is encouraged to explore their potential, discover new interests, and connect with positive mentors in a supportive community environment.
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d:
Make a difference in the lives of young people right here in our community! The Red Shield Youth Center of Charleston is always looking for caring, dedicated volunteers and mentors to join our team. Whether you’re helping with afterschool activities, assisting at camp, coaching youth sports, or simply being a positive role model, your time and encouragement can have a lasting impact.

Volunteers and mentors play a vital role in creating a safe, supportive, and fun environment for our youth. If you’re passionate about empowering the next generation, we’d love to have you join us! Call (843) 747-5271 for more information!

AboutThisCenter: Our after school program offers a safe, welcoming space for kids to play, learn, and connect with others in a loving, Christian environment. After school focuses on character development and building self-confidence. Activities include homework help, arts and crafts, daily organized recreation, and uplifting motivational/ devotional messages daily.​

Title: Front Royal
field_1: Red Shield Youth Center of Front Royal
field_23: Worship Services - Children's / Teen|Community Recreation Programs
field_24: PMC Front Royal Red Shield Youth Center
AboutThisCenter: RSYC Front Royal is located inside of E. Wilson Morrison Elementary School and accepts students within WCPS from Ressie Jeffries, A.S.Rhodes, Leslie Fox Keyser, Warren County and Skyline Middle, as well as Warren County High School. We provide both Academic and Personal Enrichment in areas ranging from Math and Reading, Social Emotional Learning, Character and Leadership, Recreation, STEM, Culinary, and Art. While attending RSYC Front Royal, students receive the opportunity to obtain homework assistance and development. We take pride on enhancing our members academic ability, proving a safe space to flourish, and demonstrating life skills needed beyond the school and the Center.
TransportationDetails: We do not provide transportation from the schools however; member attending can ride the WCPS bus from the designated school by parents informing school day staff to drop off at Center.

AboutThisCenter: Our Red Shield Youth Center offers guidance and support for young people who can connect to services for the family unit through The Salvation Army Corps (Church). Our Center provides a fun, safe, and constructive environment for kids during out-of-school hours (after school and summer). The Center is aligned around three outcome areas and provides programs for each: education, character/leadership development, and outreach. We work alongside parents/guardians and volunteers to help youth fulfill their God-given purpose.

Title: Hagerstown
FooterScriptureVerse: "Start children off on the way they should go, and even when they are old they will not turn from it." Proverbs 22:6
field_1: Red Shield Youth Center of Hagerstown
field_23: Worship Services - Children's / Teen|Community Recreation Programs
field_24: PMC Hagerstown Red Shield Youth Center
AboutThisCenter:
The Red Shield Youth Center in Hagerstown, Maryland, provides a safe, supportive, and engaging environment where children can learn, grow, and thrive. During the school year, our After School program runs weekdays from 2:30-6:30pm., offering academic support, recreational activities, arts and crafts, life-skills, and free meals for all participants. Each Monday evening, our character-building program gives children the opportunity to develop strong values, leadership skills, and a sense of community.
In the Summer months, we offer a summer day camp program filled with fun, learning, and friendship, as well as overnight camping experiences that help youth build confidence and lasting memories. 
Through all our programs, the Red Shield Youth Center is committed to fostering the mental, emotional, and spiritual growth of every child who walks through our doors.
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d: For information on how to volunteer in our Red Shield Youth Center, please call  301-302-8097 or stop in to see us at 525 George Street in Hagerstown, Maryland.

Title: Henderson
FooterScriptureVerse: “We love each other because he loved us first.” 1 John 4:19
field_1: Red Shield Youth Center of Henderson
field_23: Worship Services - Children's / Teen|Community Recreation Programs
field_24: NSC Red Shield Youth Center of Henderson
AboutThisCenter:
At The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center, we take great pride in providing a safe, nurturing environment where young people can grow, learn, and become strong leaders for Christ. Since opening our doors in 2019, we have been truly blessed to serve the youth of Henderson and the surrounding community.

Our mission is to help every child understand the love of Christ, develop respect for others, and learn how to model their lives after Jesus in all they do. Through mentorship, educational support, recreation, and faith-based programs, we strive to equip our youth with the confidence and character to make a positive impact in their homes, schools, and neighborhoods.

We invite you to stop by and visit us at The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center — come see firsthand how God is transforming lives and building a brighter future for our community!
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d:
We’re looking for volunteers to help with supporting our youth during our afterschool program. Are you a retired teacher, or just enjoy helping younger children? Send a quick email to hope.allen@uss.salvationarmy.org or call 252.438.7107 ext. 66610.

Your time and energy can make a real difference! Whether you can give a few hours or more, every bit helps.

Title: Hickory
FooterScriptureVerse: John 13:34 (ICB) - "I give you a new command:  Love each other. You must love each other as I have loved you.”
field_1: Red Shield Youth Center of Hickory
field_23: Worship Services - Children's / Teen|Community Recreation Programs
field_24: NSC Hickory Boys and Girls Club
AboutThisCenter:
Our goal is to facilitate a program that develops youth who:

  • Are filled with the love of Christ and share that love with others

  • Have developed a good, strong character and take actions that make a difference in the community

  • Graduate on time, are motivated to learn, and have a plan to succeed in today’s modern workforce

  • Make healthy lifestyle decisions resulting in spiritual, social, emotional, and physical well-being
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d:
Volunteer Opportunities:

  • Homework Helper - help youth complete homework

  • Tutor - help youth develop and practice reading or math skills

  • Mentor / Leader - help supervise youth and bond with them

  • Secretary / Front Office Assistant - greet youth and remind them to sign in and out; greet families and hand out information as needed

  • Cleaning / Organizing - help clean / organize specific areas of the Youth Center as needed


Contact Kelsey for more information: kelsey.biggers@uss.salvationarmy.org

(828)312-0775
TransportationDetails:
During the After School program, we pick up from participating schools each day, including on early release days.

During the Spring Break and Summer Camp programs, we transport youth to and from field trips each day.

field_24: PMC Red Shield Youth Center of Richmond
AboutThisCenter:
The Salvation Army Central Virginia Red Shield Youth Center is a place for your kids to laugh.

A place to learn. A place to grow. A place to belong.

Our programming focuses on our core program areas of education, character development, health and lifestyle, arts, morality, and sports.

After school, children have a designated environment to continue their education and work on homework. Before breaking into recreational programs, children receive a nutritious snack and do devotionals as a group.

Our Summer Day Camp is designed to prevent summer learning loss. Summer learning loss stacks up from year to year, broadening the achievement gap between lower- and higher-income youth. We offer developmentally appropriate, project-based learning materials to help keep children educated and engaged throughout the summer.
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d: If you would like more information about volunteering at our Red Shield Youth Center, please contact Jae Pickering at (804) 591-3815.
TransportationDetails: A monthly fee of $25 will be charged for after-school bus transportation, and additional fees may apply for scheduled field trips.

field_23: Worship Services - Children's / Teen|Community Recreation Programs
field_24: ALM Red Shield Youth Center of Shreveport
AboutThisCenter:
The Red Shield Youth Center is where potential ignites and futures are forged! We're not just a center; we're a vibrant hub dedicated to fueling the ambitions of every young person and strengthening the heart of our community. We are shaping tomorrow's leaders, innovators, and creators today.


    Step into a world where growth knows no bounds. The Red Shield Youth Center is a sanctuary—a dynamic, safe, and nurturing space meticulously designed for students and families to not just survive, but to truly thrive. Unleash creativity in our cutting-edge makerspace, dominate the field in athletics, dive deep into the wonders of STEM, or express yourself through captivating arts and media programs.


    Academic success is within reach with our dedicated homework assistance and personalized tutoring, ensuring every student is equipped to excel. The Red Shield Youth Center is more than an after-school program; it's a launchpad for dreams, a canvas for talent, and a testament to what a community can achieve when it invests in its youth.
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d:
At the Red Shield Youth Center, our incredible volunteers are the heart of everything we do! We simply couldn't achieve our mission of empowering youth without the passion, dedication, and invaluable support of individuals like you. If you're looking to make a real difference, we have a wide range of rewarding volunteer roles available to suit various skills and interests.

    We invite you to become a vital part of our team, helping us do the most good to improve the lives of our youth. To express your interest, please complete our volunteer interest form, and a member of our staff will promptly reach out to discuss exciting opportunities and answer any questions you may have.

    To ensure the safety and well-being of all participants, every interested volunteer is required to complete our "Safe from Harm" training before being placed in a position. We offer this essential training once per quarter for all new volunteers, providing you with the necessary tools and knowledge to contribute effectively in a secure environment.

Volunteer Interest Form
TransportationDetails:
Ensuring your child's safe and convenient transportation to our after-school program is a top priority for us. We understand the importance of reliable pick-up services, allowing families peace of mind and consistent participation in our enriching activities.

    To facilitate easy access for our members, we are pleased to offer complimentary pick-up services directly from several local schools. Our dedicated staff will be available to transport students from Judson, JS. Clark, Midway, and Oak Park.

    These pick-up services are consistently provided Monday through Friday, promptly at 3:00 PM. We are committed to making your child's journey to the Red Shield Youth Center as smooth and stress-free as possible.

AboutThisCenter:
Nestled in Spartanburg, South Carolina, our community center offers a Christ-centered approach to everything we do! Here at the Salvation Army, we believe that serving our brothers and sisters is our duty to God, and you can feel that when you walk through our doors. 

Our Current Programs: Afterschool Childcare, Senior Bible Study and Church services.


For more information about our community center here in Spartanburg, SC, our Red Shield Youth Center Program Manager, Peyton Sealy, can be reached at the following locations:

  • Email: peyton.sealy@uss.salvationarmy.org 
    • For fastest response, please use email.
  • Phone: (864) 576-8330
    • If we are unable to take your call, please leave a detailed voicemail and someone will get back to you as soon as we possibly can!
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d:

Please contact Peyton Sealy at peyton.sealy@uss.salvationarmy.org

Thank you!

AboutThisCenter:
The Red Shield Youth Center of Sumter is a welcoming, safe, and supportive place where children can play, learn, and grow into confident, caring, and capable young adults. As part of The Salvation Army’s Red Shield Youth Centers network, we provide after-school and summer enrichment programs that help youth build friendships, explore interests, and develop real-world skills in an environment rooted in positive values and community support.

Our programs are designed to nurture the whole child — academically, socially, emotionally, and spiritually — through engaging activities like tutoring and homework support, arts and creative projects, sports and fitness, leadership opportunities, and special community events. With trained staff and caring mentors, we strive to empower every young person who walks through our doors to reach their full potential.

At Red Shield Youth Center of Sumter, every child is valued, every voice is heard, and every moment is an opportunity to grow. We’re committed to building a stronger community by helping youth discover their strengths, build character, and become positive leaders at home, in school, and beyond.
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d:
Rebekah Ardis 

Administrative Assistant 

(803) 775-9336
TransportationDetails:
The Red Shield Youth Center of Sumter is committed to providing safe and reliable transportation to ensure youth can participate fully in our programs. Transportation is offered to and from select Sumter area schools during the school year, helping students arrive safely after school and return home at the end of the day.

All transportation is supervised by trained staff and follows established safety guidelines. Vehicles are regularly maintained, and youth are monitored throughout transit to ensure a secure and positive experience.

Transportation availability may vary based on program schedules, school locations, and capacity. Parents and guardians must complete all required permission and registration forms prior to transportation services being provided.

Title: Texarkana
CustomFacilityFeaturesNotListed: Our facilities are designed to be flexible and multi-purpose, allowing spaces to adapt to the curriculum and activities being offered. During extended hours, we also take part in off-site excursions-ranging from recreational outings, such as visits to waterparks, to meaningful community service opportunities like volunteering with Harvest Texarkana. Each experience is intentionally planned to be both fun and educational, supporting well-rounded growth for our youth.

FeaturedPrograms.Value: Character and Leadership Evidence Based Programming

CustomProgramsNotListed:
The Salvation Army Red Shield Youth Center of Texarkana is a comprehensive after-school program serving youth ages 5–18. Our goal is to provide a safe, supportive environment where young people can learn, grow, and discover their potential. We focus on building strong foundations through homework assistance, tutoring, and life-skills education that helps students succeed both in and out of the classroom.

Our programs are intentionally diverse and hands-on, offering opportunities in the arts, music, cooking, self-defense, STEAM education, and creative expression. From learning practical skills like budgeting and meal preparation to exploring science, technology, and the arts, our youth are encouraged to try new things, build confidence, and develop independence. Simply put—if it’s positive, educational, and legal, we want our kids exposed to it here.

Through engaging instruction, caring mentors, and community partnerships, the Red Shield Youth Center equips young people with the tools they need to thrive today and become responsible, capable adults tomorrow.
FooterScriptureVerse: But Jesus said, "Let the children alone, and do not hinder them from coming to Me; for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these."  Mathew 19:14
field_1: Red Shield Youth Center of Texarkana
field_23: Worship Services - Children's / Teen|Community Recreation Programs
field_24: TEX Red Shield Youth Center of Texarkana
AboutThisCenter:
The Red Shield Youth Center of Texarkana is a safe, welcoming space where kids and teens can play, learn, and grow. Through engaging programs, mentorship, and community activities, we provide opportunities for youth to build friendships, discover new passions, and develop essential life skills.

To cultivate a thriving community where young people are empowered to reach their full potential, supported by strong families, and guided by spiritual and moral values. We envision a future where youth are inspired to lead, serve, and contribute positively to their churches, families, and communities.

With a focus on creativity, leadership, and personal growth, our center empowers young people to reach their full potential in a supportive and fun environment. Whether it’s through sports, arts, academics, or leadership programs, there’s something for everyone at the Red Shield Youth Center of Texarkana.
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d:
Volunteer With Us

The Red Shield Youth Center welcomes volunteers who are passionate about making a positive impact in the lives of young people. Volunteers are an essential part of our after-school and summer programs and special events, and there are many ways to get involved.

If you are interested in volunteering, please contact, Chasity Russell, the Center Director at 870-772-2701 or 903-319-4752 or email at chasity.russell@uss.salvationarmy.org to discuss current opportunities. 

All volunteers are required to complete a background check and Safe from Harm training prior to serving.

Volunteer opportunities include assisting with daily program sessions, helping with setup and breakdown for special events, and teaching sessions of your own. Sessions may be part of a pre-planned program or something you are passionate about sharing. This could include hobbies such as sewing, cooking, esports, or arts, as well as life-skills lessons like budgeting, basic car maintenance, or other practical skills.

If it’s safe, legal, and educational, we want it taught here. Your time and talents can make a lasting difference.
TransportationDetails:
Transportation

While the Red Shield Youth Center does not currently provide daily transportation services, we are proud to partner with the Texarkana Arkansas School District to ensure students can arrive safely after school. All eight schools within the district offer after-school transportation that drops students off directly at the front doors of the Youth Center.

Transportation arrangements can be easily completed through the school district’s website. If you need assistance with this process, please feel free to reach out to our staff—we are happy to help guide you.

During extended school breaks and throughout the summer, the Red Shield Youth Center does provide transportation for all scheduled excursions and off-site activities.

Our physical drop-off address is 315 E. 4th Street, Texarkana, AR.

TransportationDetails: The Red Shield Youth Center utilizes a diverse transportation fleet to support its after-school program. Our fleet includes two 13-passenger buses, two 12-passenger vans, and one 8-passenger minivan. These vehicles are used daily to safely transport children from their schools to our facility, ensuring consistent access to programming and minimizing transportation barriers for participating families.

AboutThisCenter:
At the Franklin Square Red Shield Youth Center, kids walk through our doors ready to explore new ideas, build new skills, and discover what they’re capable of. Our after-school programs are designed to spark creativity and boost confidence whether students are tackling homework, diving into hands-on activities, or trying something brand new.

Our staff and volunteers are right there each day, offering personalized academic support, encouragement, and a safe space to grow. With affordable program options, families can feel at ease knowing their children are supported, challenged, and trusted to grow in a safe environment.

field_24: NSC Charlotte Belmont Red Shield Youth Center
AboutThisCenter: The Salvation Army’s high-quality after-school program, at our Belmont Red Shield Youth Centers, serve children and youth of all ages. Our staff and volunteers provide one-on-one assistance with homework and school assignments, as well as the teaching and advancement of literacy and study skills. Our no-fee or low-cost after-school programs offer children a chance to play sports, learn athletic skills, and cultivate healthy, safe relationships with friends through better social skills.
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d: Individuals looking to make an impact with youth at our Red Shield Youth Centers can sign up to volunteer by completing the background check, and volunteer application on our website at salvationarmycharlotte.org.

With a focus on creativity, leadership, and personal growth, our center empowers young people to reach their full potential in a supportive and fun environment. Whether it’s through sports, arts, academics, or leadership programs, there’s something for everyone at the Red Shield Youth Center Teen Center.
Volunteer_x002f_MentorSign_x002d: We'd love to have you join us as a volunteer at our Red Shield Teen Center! You can pick up a volunteer packet at our front desk, or feel free to contact us at 210-736-5102 or at angela.davis@uss.salvationarmy.org.
TransportationDetails: We provide transportation for our after-school program from several surrounding schools including Fenwick Academy, Madison elementary, Woodlawn Academy, Beacon Hill primary, Cotton Academy, Longfellow Middle School, and Jefferson High School.
